<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Junk Tinker](/Feats.aspx?ID=4444) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Goblin" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=81" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 56 <sup>2.0</sup>

</column>

---

You can make useful tools out of even twisted or rusted scraps. When using the [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) skill to [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=43), you can make level 0 items, including weapons and armor, out of junk. This reduces the Price to one-quarter the usual amount but always results in a [shoddy item](/Rules.aspx?ID=197). Shoddy items normally give a penalty, but you don't take this penalty when using shoddy items you made (nor does the worse check penalty of shoddy armor you made apply to you).

You can also incorporate junk to save money while you Craft any item. This grants you a discount on the item as if you had spent 1 additional day working to reduce the cost, but the item is obviously made of junk. At the GM's discretion, this might affect the item's resale value depending on the buyer's tastes.
